meanings.definition: To write, engrave, or mark again
meanings.sent1: She carefully reinscribed her name on the book cover.
meanings.sent2: The artist decided to reinscribe the date on the sculpture.
meanings.sent3: After the rain washed it away, he had to reinscribe the message on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent4: The memories were so vivid, she felt the need to reinscribe them in her journal.
meanings.sent5: The ancient tablet was reinscribed with new symbols by the archaeologist.

meanings.definition: To establish or reaffirm a belief or idea
meanings.sent1: The teacher wanted to reinscribe the importance of kindness in the students' minds.
meanings.sent2: He decided to reinscribe his commitment to environmental conservation.
meanings.sent3: The movie's plot twist helped reinscribe his faith in storytelling.
meanings.sent4: Her actions spoke louder than words, reinscribing her dedication to the cause.
meanings.sent5: The wise words of the elder reinscribed the value of patience in the young ones.

meanings.definition: To renew or restore something to its original state
meanings.sent1: The renovation project aimed to reinscribe the historic building to its former glory.
meanings.sent2: The artist's goal was to reinscribe the faded painting to its original vibrancy.
meanings.sent3: His apology helped reinscribe trust in their relationship.
meanings.sent4: The rainbows after the storm seemed to reinscribe hope in the hearts of the villagers.
meanings.sent5: The old tradition was reinscribed with new meaning for the modern generation.
